name: Baby Kale
properties: More delicate texture than mature kale
Part of Daily Dozen cruciferous vegetables
Rich in vitamins A, C, and K
No need to remove stems - entirely edible
benefits: Baby kale provides all the nutritional benefits of mature kale with a more tender, less bitter taste. As a cruciferous vegetable, it's exceptionally high in antioxidants, vitamins A, C, and K, and anti-inflammatory compounds. The younger leaves cook quickly and don't require stem removal, making them convenient for soups and quick-cooking dishes. Part of the Daily Dozen vegetables and particularly valuable for its thylakoid content which helps with appetite suppression and fat absorption.

quotes: Stir in the baby kale and chickpeas. Cover and cook until the kale is wilted, 2 to 3 minutes.
